description: PolygonSymbol3D is used to render features with Polygon geometry in a 3D SceneView. Polygon features may also be rendered as points with icons or objects at the centroid of each polygon.
title: PolygonSymbol3D

___symbolLayers.description: A Collection of Symbol3DLayer objects used to visualize the graphic or feature.

$eref.description: FillSymbol3DLayer is used to render the surfaces of flat 2D Polygon geometries and 3D volumetric meshes in a SceneView.
$eref.title: FillSymbol3DLayer

___type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

___edges.description: Specifies an edge visualization style. Only affects MeshSymbol3D.

$eref.description: ExtrudeSymbol3DLayer is used to render Polygon geometries by extruding them upward from the ground, creating a 3D volumetric object.
$eref.title: ExtrudeSymbol3DLayer

___type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

$eref.description: IconSymbol3DLayer is used to render Point geometries using a flat 2D icon (e.g. a circle) with a PointSymbol3D in a SceneView.
$eref.title: IconSymbol3DLayer

___type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

___size.description: Icon size in points, positive only

esriDocumentation.additionalInformation: [Anchor and `origin`](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-symbols-ObjectSymbol3DLayer.html#anchor) in ArcGIS API for JavaScript.

$eref.description: ObjectSymbol3DLayer is used to render Point geometries using a volumetric 3D shape (e.g., a sphere or cylinder) with a Symbol3D in a SceneView.
$eref.title: ObjectSymbol3DLayer

___roll.description: Rotation angle around Y axis in degrees. At 0 degrees, the model is level. A positive value lifts the left part and lowers the right part of the model. [Detailed description](static/objectSymbolLayerOrientation.md).

___tilt.description: Rotation angle around X axis in degrees. At 0 degrees, the model is level. A positive value lifts the front and lowers the back of the model. [Detailed description](static/objectSymbolLayerOrientation.md).

___anchor.description: The positioning of the object relative to the geometry.

___type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

___depth.description: Object depth in meters, positive only

___height.description: Object height in meters, positive only

___width.description: Object width in meters, positive only

___heading.description: Rotation angle around Z axis in degrees. At 0 degrees, the model points in the direction of the Y-axis. Positive values indicate clockwise rotation (when looked at from the top). [Detailed description](static/objectSymbolLayerOrientation.md).

$eref.description: LineSymbol3DLayer renders Polyline geometries using a flat 2D line with a LineSymbol3D in a 3D SceneView.

___type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

___size.description: Line width in points, positive only

___type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

$eref.description: The origin of the style from which the symbol was originally referenced. A reference to the style origin can be either by styleName or by styleUrl (but not both). It may be used to understand where a symbol was originally sourced from, but does not affect actual appearance or rendering of the symbol.
$eref.title: styleOrigin

___name.description: Identifies a symbol in the style by name.

___styleName.description: A registered web style name, such as `EsriThematicShapesStyle`
